arm_group.description: Long Term follow up of patients who received RetinoStat in a previous study.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine the long term safety of an experimental gene
      transfer agent, RetinoStat®, designed to treat neovascular age-related macular degeneration.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Follow-up Study to Evaluate the Safety of RetinoStat® in Patients With Age-Related Macular Degeneration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must have received a subretinal injection of RetinoStat

          -  Must have been enrolled in Protocol RS1/001/10

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Did not receive RetinoStat® as part of the RS1/001/10 protocol

intervention.description: Long Term Follow up of patients who received RetinoStat in a previous study

clinical_study.official_title: A Long Term Follow-up Study to Evaluate the Safety of RetinoStat® in Patients With Age-Related Macular Degeneration

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with treatment emergent adverse events.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in Best Corrective Visual Acuity.
secondary_outcome.measure: The change from baseline in BCVA.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
